chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
q: nat

Goal:
p <> 0 -> rem q p < p

Premises:
rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments rem (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
div_rem_spec1 : forall q p : nat, q = div q p * p + rem q p
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments div (_ _)%nat_scope
Pnat.Pos2Nat.inj : forall p q : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.to_nat p = BinPos.Pos.to_nat q -> p = q
is_gcd_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd q p r
is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, is_gcd p q r1 -> is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
Nat.add_le_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = q * r /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
arem = fun n d q j : nat => j <= d /\ (n = 2 * q * d + j \/ q <> 0 /\ n = 2 * q * d - j) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments arem (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : nat, 0 < p -> n < m < -> p * n < p * m
Nat.mul_lt_mono_neg_l : forall p n m : nat, p < 0 -> n < m < -> p * m < p * n
Nat.div_lt_upper_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a < b * q -> a / b < q
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
division_by_even : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {j : nat | arem n d q j}}
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists p : nat, y' = p * x')) (Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff...
Nat.mul_divide_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> Nat.divide (n * p) (m * p) < -> Nat.divide n m
Nat.mul_divide_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> Nat.divide (p * n) (p * m) < -> Nat.divide n m
Nat.div_unique_exact : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * q -> q = a / b
Nat.div_le_lower_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> b * q <= a -> q <= a / b
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => match m with | BinNums.N0 => true | BinNums.Npos _ => false end | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => false | BinNums.Npos q => BinPos.Pos.eqb p q end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => m | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => n | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.add p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.mul_le_mono_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
Nat.mul_le_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
is_gcd_0l : forall p : nat, is_gcd 0 p p
is_gcd_0r : forall p : nat, is_gcd p 0 p
Nat.add_sub_assoc : forall n m p : nat, p <= m -> n + (m - p) = n + m - p
Nat.gauss : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n (m * p) -> Nat.gcd n m = 1 -> Nat.divide n p
is_gcd_refl : forall p : nat, is_gcd p p p
Nat.pow_gt_1 : forall a b : nat, 1 < a -> b <> 0 -> 1 < a ^ b
neq_0_lt : forall n : nat, 0 <> n -> 0 < n
Nat.pow_lt_mono_l : forall a b c : nat, c <> 0 -> a < b -> a ^ c < b ^ c
Nat.mul_sub_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n - m) * p = n * p - m * p

intros p q H. unfold rem.
unfold rem in (proj1_sig (projT2 (div_full q p))).
apply (proj2_sig (projT2 (div_full q p))). apply H.
